column4: Does anyone know why I would be getting the error "maximum=(1440,1440)" when I try to turn on a second monitor?
nvidia or ati
what does xrandr say about your allowed geometries
anything specific you want? First of all, it seems to think I have a CRT connected, which I don't, dunno if that's part of the problem or not
could very well be the source of trouble. xorg is getting better and detecting more automatically but that means it has more opportunities to detect it incorrectly
should i write it into my xorg.conf? cos it's not there now.
i would try and set it through xrandr, but if you cant you could force your modelines into xorg.conf
(also, xrandr doesn't say /anything/ about minimum=320/240 or maximum=1440/1440, which is the error Montors is giving me)
so its guessing at bad modes from the display can you force a good mode with xrandr?
i don't know how, reading the help now but i've never used it before, so

david8732, the second monitor is set to 1280/800 (max is higher) and mirror screens is on, but when I turn off mirror screens I get the error about exceeding 1440/1440. The only thing I can come up with is it thinks there's a maximum width for both screens combined, or is treating them as one screen when they're separate displays, or something of that nature. Why, I have no idea.
when you turn off mirror screens any change in what xrandr reports
i can't turn off mirror screens, that's the problem
when i try it gives me that error and reverts
trying to search for a config file with 1440 in it anywhere right now...
no problems playing the audio?
no. I just took a look at the log, it's failing because I'm burning FLAC files now
it's odd, I can put the flac in the project, but as soon as it tries to start preparing the burn it ejects the CD instead
have you installed restricted-extras?
what's the package name (no)
ubuntu-restricted-extras
